definitions: To cease work or movement in order to relax, sleep, or recover strength.
To be supported by or to be situated on something.
To remain or be left in a specified state or position.
To be based on or depend on something.
To place something in a particular position, especially so that it is supported by something else.
examples: She rests after a long day.
The book rests on the table.
The decision rests with the committee.
His argument rests on a false premise.
